It was almost a good month.

Then, slippage happened.  

That's life.

Shit happens.

Here are the trade breakdowns for October 2025:

Another bleh month for non-0DTE trades.  Main losses came from Option Alpha "trade ideas" again.  I am looking at these trades as more of hedge trades now rather than income trades.

Very good month for 0DTE and 1DTE.

Particularly, 1DTE had a huge month (+$1358).  The market continues to be super bullish, so any bullish strategies are porbably killing it right now.


## TOTALS

+ 0DTE + 1DTE Trades = 143.08
+ Other Trades = -221.39

**TOTAL PROFIT/LOSS = -$78.31**

Total number of trades = 137

## Notes and Thoughts

A whole bunch of trades, and nothing to show for it.

### Oct 14 Slippage

I LOST an extra $900 due to some big volatility spike and slippage on Oct 14th.  Basically, price dropped so suddenly that stops got auto-triggered and filled very poorly by brokers.

So, without this, I would've actually had an OK month (i.e. $700 or so profit). 

Many other traders had the same issues, and some complained to their brokers without much avail.

This shit apparently happens 2-3 times a year, so I guess maybe should expect it.  Some people say it's happening more often these days, but I don't know.  I haven't been in the game long enough.

### Debit trades

My debit trade experiment has been failing tremendously after the first month (-$700).  Without these trades, I also would've had a good month.  Maybe something is set up wrong.

With volatility expanding, also maybe not the best time to test debit trades either.

Oh well, on to the next month!
